techmeme.title: France and the UAE agree to develop an up to 1 GW data center in France, representing €30B to €50B in investments for French and Emirati AI, chips, and more (Daphné Leprince-Ringuet/Sifted)
Kelly Stonelake, a former Meta director who was at the company from 2009 to 2024, sues Meta, alleging sexual harassment, sex discrimination, and retaliation (TechCrunch)
Amazon expects to boost its capex to $100B in 2025, largely driven by AI and up from 2024's ~$83B, in what Andy Jassy calls a "once-in-a-lifetime" opportunity (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
Sources: Apple plans to unveil its long-awaited overhaul of the iPhone SE as early as next week, opting to reveal it on its website instead of at a launch event (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
Affirm reports Q2 revenue up 47% YoY to $866M, vs. $807M est., GMV up 35% YoY to $10.1B, and active consumers up 23% YoY to 21M; AFRM jumps 10%+ after hours (MacKenzie Sigalos/CNBC)
